blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-4671 chromium-browser: use after free in Visuals

long_desc.thetext:
Use after free in Visuals. Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4671 exists in the wild.

Upstream bug(s):

https://issues.chromium.org/issues/339266700

External References:

https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/05/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_9.html

Created chromium tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2280247]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2280246

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2280246,2280247

# Description of your update

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

comment.text: Yes, basic web browsing features work like normal.
All basic features seem to be working.

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:

I'm trying to make use of headless_shell with opensearch-reporting-cli but it segfaults.  Hard to say what is going on because there is no debug info.

  Command Line: /usr/lib64/chromium-browser/headless_shell --allow-pre-commit-input --disable-background-networking --enable-features=NetworkServiceInProcess2 --disable-background-timer-throttling --disable-backgrounding-occluded-windows --disable-breakpad --disable-client-side-phishing-detection --disable-component-extensions-with-background-pages --disable-default-apps --disable-dev-shm-usage --disable-extensions --disable-features=Translate,BackForwardCache,AcceptCHFrame,AvoidUnnecessaryBeforeUnloadCheckSync --disable-hang-monitor --disable-ipc-flooding-protection --disable-popup-blocking --disable-prompt-on-repost --disable-renderer-backgrounding --disable-sync --force-color-profile=srgb --metrics-recording-only --no-first-run --enable-automation --password-store=basic --use-mock-keychain --enable-blink-features=IdleDetection --export-tagged-pdf --headless --hide-scrollbars --mute-audio about:blank --no-sandbox --disable-setuid-sandbox --disable-gpu --disable-dev-shm-usage --no-zygote --font-render-hinting=none --enable-features=NetworkService --ignore-certificate-errors --single-process --remote-debugging-port=0 --user-data-dir=/tmp/puppeteer_dev_chrome_profile-XXXXXXUbIf0Q

Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
123.0.6312.122-1.el8.x86_6

How reproducible:
everytime

Steps to Reproduce:
Hard to say as it's being called from another app.

Additional info:
# /usr/lib64/chromium-browser/headless_shell https://www.google.com
Fontconfig error: Cannot load default config file: No such file: (null)
[0521/155643.613318:WARNING:runtime_features.cc(728)] AttributionReportingCrossAppWeb cannot be enabled in this configuration. Use --enable-features=ConversionMeasurement,AttributionReportingCrossAppWeb in addition.
[0521/155643.590364:WARNING:sandbox_linux.cc(418)] InitializeSandbox() called with multiple threads in process gpu-process.
[0521/155643.649202:WARNING:runtime_features.cc(728)] AttributionReportingCrossAppWeb cannot be enabled in this configuration. Use --enable-features=ConversionMeasurement,AttributionReportingCrossAppWeb in addition.
[0521/155643.693019:ERROR:interface_endpoint_client.cc(707)] Message 0 rejected by interface blink.mojom.WidgetHost

bugs.title: CVE-2024-5157 CVE-2024-5158 CVE-2024-5159 CVE-2024-5160 chromium: various flaws [epel-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-5157 CVE-2024-5158 CVE-2024-5159 CVE-2024-5160 chromium: various flaws [epel-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-5157 chromium-browser: Use after free in Scheduling

long_desc.thetext:
An use after free flaw was found in the Scheduling component of the Chromium browser.

Upstream bug(s):

https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=336012573

External References:

https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/05/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_21.html

Created chromium tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2282818]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2282817]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-5158 chromium-browser: Type Confusion in V8

long_desc.thetext:
A type confusion flaw was found in the V8 component of the Chromium browser.

Upstream bug(s):

https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=338908243

External References:

https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/05/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_21.html

Created chromium tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2282818]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2282817]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-5159 chromium-browser: Heap buffer overflow in ANGLE

long_desc.thetext:
A heap buffer overflow flaw was found in the ANGLE component of the Chromium browser.

Upstream bug(s):

https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=335613092

External References:

https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/05/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_21.html

Created chromium tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2282818]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2282817]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-5160 chromium-browser: Heap buffer overflow in Dawn

long_desc.thetext:
Heap buffer overflow was found in the in Dawn component of the Chromium browser.

Upstream bug(s):

https://issues.chromium.org/issues/338161969

External References:

https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/05/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_21.html

Created chromium tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2282818]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2282817]

More information about these security flaws is available in the following bugs:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2282814
http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2282813
http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2282816
http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2282812

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=high

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2282812,2282813,2282814,2282816,2282818

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
